part_5.question_text: Jensen Financial Ltd. plans to open new branch offices __________ the southern part of the country.
Mountain hikers are encouraged to _____long pants throughout the year to protect their legs from thorns.
The new Sonos digital camera is smaller but more powerful _____its previous model.
Rexon Auto Company’s annual meeting _____shareholders will be held on Thursday, April 11.
Both the manager_____ the individual member of the staff are responsible for accomplishing the project successfully.
The automobile company Nexon Ltd. Has decided to_____the prices across all its seven brands due to the material cost hike.
Our guests are encouraged to indicate their meal_____ when they respond to our invitation.
For a_____time only, customers will receive two hundred dollars’ worth of home theater equipment when they purchase an LCD TV.
Please check the condition of the packages very _____when they arrive at the loading dock.
The apprenticeship program is popular with students pursuing technical_____.
_____complex regulations, the opening of Quinn’s Computers’ local factory will be postponed until next year.
Weather forecasters _____that heavy snow would come all over the country throughout the night.
_____you have finished your travel expense report, please send it to the accounting office.
Last-minute problems in the design of the new motorcycle could not have been solved without the _____of the intern designer, Peter Benson.
The toy dealers think that the procedures for assembling the miniature ship are overly _____for most customers.
Investors have to use financial information on major companies, which is _____ accessible and clearly presented online.
As _____in our rental agreement, rental cars should be returned to the original rental location with a full tank of gas.
Supercard holders can use the points of the credit card _____ they shop online.
If you have any ideas for a new project you would like to_____, please submit it at the monthly meeting.
The office complex on Ocean Street has been _____for a year due to high rental prices.
In his most recent work, Tomoyaki Yamamoto has_____ to blend traditional and modern music resulting in relaxing melodies.
Instead of buying a commercial bookkeeping system, the accountants of Haldenman Finance decided to design one of_____.
The manufacturing process of MJD Foods International is _____ monitored by our quality assurance team.
Our North American and Asian markets have grown_____ stronger since the company’s launch five years ago.
Vacation request forms must be submitted at least 10 days prior and____ by the department manager.
Customers should be careful because computer software products are not refundable, _____opened or not.
Job candidates are advised to avoid asking questions_____ to working hours and benefits at a job interview.
Our technicians spent the busy summer responding to customers _____ air-conditioning systems failed because of overuse.
By intensifying the quality control, James Alvart, the company president, expressed his full _____ to serving the best interests of customers.
The department managers would need _____ flexibility in hiring temporary workers to deal with increased work load.

part_6.paragraph: To: All StaffFrom: Naomi MizoI, Office ManagerSubject: Eugene PippenHello Everyone,As I discussed briefly in last week’s staff meeting, Eugene Pippen, the company’s public relations director, has resigned from his role here at Virginia Consulting. Mr. Pippen has decided to ---131--- a position with a major investment group, Haymond Investments.This job will allow Mr. Pippen to plan publicity campaigns on a larger scale. ---132---. Therefore, this is an excellent opportunity for him both professionally and personally. ---133---, we are sincerely disappointed to lose him as an employee.Mr. Pippen’s final day of work will be Wednesday, March 18. On that day, we will hold a small ceremony in the main conference room ---134--- his many years of service. It will begin at 4 P.M., and everyone is welcome to attend.Cheers, Naomi Mizell

answers: (A) This new role at Haymond Investments is a perfect fit.
(B) However, we are excited to see what he will do next.
(C) Mr. Pippen’s replacement has not yet been announced.
(D) It will also require less travel away from his family.
questions.correct_answer: (D) It will also require less travel away from his family.

If the new system proves to be successful, as we expect it will, we will implement it across all purchasing sectors. Updates will be given to your team leaders ---138--- as they become available.Thank you for your cooperation.Doris EdwardsManager, Purchasing Department

part_6.paragraph: Local Jewelry Designer ShinesDANBURY HEIGHTS—Jewelry designer Caro Webster has come a long way since making friendship bracelets out of yarn in her teen years. When she was offered a scholarship to the Vanderbilt Institute of Arts, she couldn’t ---139--- the opportunity to advance her skills and formally learn the art of jewelry design.Upon completing her education, Webster started her own jewelry business. She opened a small shop in the growing Swanson neighborhood and sold a wide range of unique handmade jewelry, ---140--- necklaces, bracelets, and rings.Due to the popularity of the shop, Webster decided to procure investment funds and open a second location opposite Fenway Department Store. The shop was fully ---141--- within a few short weeks. “My goal is to create stunning objects that make people look and feel beautiful,” Webster says. She also wants to continue growing her business. ---142---.

answers: (A) Webster even plans to open a third store early next year.
(B) Thanks to its success, she intends to pay investors back next year.
(C) She credits her success to the training she received at Vanderbilt.
(D) Her jewelry is expensive, but the quality is worth the price.
questions.correct_answer: (A) Webster even plans to open a third store early next year.

part_7.paragraph:
The Chicago Star - April 4Parker Airlines to Sell Food On-Board its AircraftParker Airlines spokesperson, Emily Green told reporters yesterday that as of May 28 the company intends to discontinue free meals for passengers flying by economy class. — [1] —. The company, named the Best Domestic Airline for the past 3 years by air travelers, expects this will save them $10 million a year. — [2] —. While the airline will continue to offer water, coffee, juice and tea for free, it will give passengers the option of buying snack boxes for $7. For breakfast, French toast and cereal will be provided; for lunch, passengers can choose either a hamburger or beef sandwich, with some fruit. For dinner, passengers will have the choice of turkey or pork with rice and salad, with ice cream for dessert.
— [3] —. Dellavue Air, based in New York was the first to implement this type of policy. Brighton International and Northern Air adopted it as well. SkyBus announced that it will test the concept to see whether or not it would be beneficial for them. — [4] —. A spokesman for Parker Airlines said that meals would still be provided free of charge to First Class passengers.

questions.question_text: What is the main topic of the article?
answers: (A) Targeted yearly financial goals for Parker Airlines
(B) The revised service policy of Parker Airlines
(D) Developing healthy eating habits while traveling by air
questions.correct_answer: (B) The revised service policy of Parker Airlines

questions.question_text: What is implied about Parker Airlines?
answers: (A) It is about to be sold to a competitor.
(C) It has a good reputation among travelers.
(D) It will merge with another company.
questions.correct_answer: (C) It has a good reputation among travelers.

questions.question_text: Which airline does NOT charge passengers for meals?
In which of the positions marked [1], [2], [3] and [4] does the following sentence best belong? “A few other airlines have already begun to sell food on board.”

part_7.paragraph:
Walkerton City Council Approves
Withering Heights Project 
February 15 — Larocco Construction Firm has won approval from the city planning committee to build a retirement community called Withering Heights in Walkerton. The residential area is to be built on the former site of the St. Catharines Motel on Highway 55, within walking distance of the city shopping mall.
This is great news for Larocco Construction; however, before the company can officially begin to build, the project designs must be approved by the State Safety Council (SSC). The retirement village’s design includes 39 town house units divided equally into 3-building blocks. Each townhouse unit will have three bedrooms, two bathrooms, and a private garage. Additional features include a group banquet facility and fitness center. Pricing will not be finalized until final SSC approval has been granted.
Walkerton resident, Steven Patterson started Larocco Construction Firm more than 15 years ago and now runs it with his brother James. City mayor, Julia Flatt, said that city administration is thrilled with how the Patterson brothers have dealt with the project so far.

questions.question_text: What is suggested about the St. Catharines Motel?
answers: (A) It will no longer be in business.
(B) It is located beside Withering Heights.
(C) It has been sold to the city council.
(D) It was constructed by the Larocco Construction
questions.correct_answer: (A) It will no longer be in business.

questions.question_text: When is construction expected to begin?
answers: (A) When the Walkerton Council grants approval
(B) When the design of the shopping mall is complete
(C) When the St. Catharines Motel closes their business
(D) When the SSC approves the plans
questions.correct_answer: (D) When the SSC approves the plans

questions.question_text: What is NOT mentioned as a feature of the facility?
Who is Steven Patterson?
answers: (C) The owner of the St. Catharines Motel

part_7.paragraph:
Susie Miller [2:15 P.M.]
Have you contacted the technical department yet? These documents have to be sent to the downtown office by fax. It is still down.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------Amy Timber [2:16 P.M.]
Yes, I called them this morning, but they said they wouldn’t be able to send the technician until next week.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------Susie Miller [2:17 P.M.]
Oh, my goodness! The deadline for these documents is this afternoon. I guess I’ll have to deliver them myself.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------Amy Timber [2:17 P.M.]
But.... in 30 minutes, you have a meeting with clients, don’t you?
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------Susie Miller [2:18 P.M.]
Right! It’s an important meeting. To make matters worse, I have another appointment with a vice president after the meeting.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------Ted Horn [2:19 P.M.]
Why don’t you send the documents by e-mail?
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------Susie Miller [2:20 P.M.]
Thanks, but they are handwritten papers.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------Ted Horn [2:22 P.M.]
I can type all of the documents within an hour. It’s the fastest way, isn’t it?
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------Susie Miller [2:23 P.M.]
Yes, it is. I really appreciate it, Ted. Without your help, I would get into trouble now.

questions.question_text: According to the online chat discussion, what is the problem?
answers: (A) The photocopier has not been delivered.
(B) The fax machine is not working.
questions.correct_answer: (B) The fax machine is not working.

answers: (A) They should not have been delivered this afternoon.
(B) Ms. Timber is going to deliver them in person.
(C) Mr. Horn will have technicians send them by fax.
(D) They will be submitted to another office today.
questions.correct_answer: (D) They will be submitted to another office today.

questions.question_text: What does Mr. Horn offer to do?
answers: (A) Reschedule a meeting with a vice president

questions.question_text: At 2:23 P.M., what does Ms. Miller mean when she writes, “Without your help, I would get into trouble now”?
answers: (A) Ms. Miller has difficulty in sending her documents now.
(B) Ms. Miller expresses her gratitude to Mr. Horn.
(C) Ms. Miller asks Mr. Horn to help repair the fax.
(D) Ms. Miller requests Ms. Timber to attend the meeting.
questions.correct_answer: (B) Ms. Miller expresses her gratitude to Mr. Horn.

part_7.paragraph: The National Physicians Association (NPA) and the Federal Medical Research Council are pleased to announce their 20th Annual Healthcare Conference, from Thursday, May 10, to Sunday, May 13. This conference is an outstanding opportunity for practitioners and researchers to share the latest information in the field of healthcare.The conference will be held at Burgess University in St. Charles, Missouri and start with a series of one-day workshops led by leading researchers and practitioners. After the workshops, there will be three days of formal presentations and panel discussions. Representatives from the University of Texas, the American Health Institute, and the National Biological Sciences Trust will lead many of the discussions and presentations. Jake Mulholly, director of the World Federation of Family Doctors, will deliver the opening speech.If you are interested in attending this year's conference, please contact Lisa Buchanan at 202-555-4332 for full schedule and registration information.

questions.question_text: Where will the conference be held?
What will take place on the first day of the conference?

part_7.paragraph:
WATERTREATMENT FACILITYThe city of Saskatoon is currently seeking a manager for the municipal water treatment facility located in the north end of the city. This individual will be responsible for overseeing the daily operations of the facility, as well as supervising staff members and completing administrative duties. A successful candidate will demonstrate strong organizational skills, have management experience, and be familiar with spreadsheet software.
This is a full time position, offering a salary of $45,000 annually. If you meet the above qualifications and you are interested in applying, please contact Joseph Brindle at jbrindle@saskatoon.municipal.sk or by phoning 409-454¬9089.

part_7.paragraph:
Dear All Research and Development Staff,
TDC Medicare will once again be a sponsor at the annual health conference in Berlin, which will be held from February 23 to 25. The purpose of this e-mail is to recruit volunteers for our company’s information booth.
Please note that any employee who volunteers at the booth will be expected to answer some highly-technical questions. As a result, we want to ensure that at least one member of our Research and Development department is present at all times. Participation of those of you who were involved in the deployment of our new medical software is especially encouraged. This is a great opportunity for all employees to learn more about the company’s work in different areas. If interested, please contact Ms. Angela Walsh by February 2. All airfare, accommodation and conference expenses will be covered.
Sincerely yours,
Ronald Simpson
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Internal Office MemoTo : Research and Development Employees
From : Ronald Simpson, Vice President
Date: January 28
All selected volunteers will attend a mandatory meeting next month to learn how to promote the following products and services, which will be featured at our booth.
* Online patient record tracking
* Electronic specialists' referrals
* Drug research abstracts
* Quick diagnostic check tools
* Electronic prescription software
One issue that we wish to emphasize is our intent to begin publishing fewer hard copies of our print-based materials. This will allow TDC to concentrate on evolving into a leader in publishing the information online. We want to stress that this goal is communicated clearly to anyone who visits our booth.

questions.question_text: For whom are both the letter and the memo intended?
answers: (D) Employees who recently joined the company

questions.question_text: What is required of the individuals who will contact Ms. Walsh?
answers: (A) They must possess hard copies of the company’s material.
(B) They must have experience selling products.
(C) They must participate in a special training session.
(D) They must have previously staffed the company’s booths.
questions.correct_answer: (C) They must participate in a special training session.

questions.question_text: In the letter, the word “covered” in paragraph 2, line 7, is closest in meaning to
What is NOT mentioned as a part of participating in the convention?
What is indicated as a company goal?
answers: (A) Promoting products at more trade shows

part_7.paragraph:
EarthTech Construction Inc.May 15
Bainbridge and Sons Law
12 Bradford Street
Yorkshire, UK
Dear Mr. O’Neil,
It is a delight to inform you that we are submitting all relevant documents necessary in a bid for the construction of your office in Bradford. We have enclosed an estimate with this letter which includes all costs according to specifications that you provided in your initial request. We estimate completion by September 25th provided that we are given your requested project start date.
As you may know, Bradford city council has recently entrusted us with the development of the city’s new Welfare Department. Over ten reputable companies submitted bids for this project. The city council noted our singular reputation and proven commitment to quality. You will not be disappointed with EarthTech construction as your preferred contractor. We look forward to having a strong working relationship with you.
Sincerely,
Michael Eves
General Manager
EarthTech Construction Inc.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
To: Mr. O’Neil (oneil@bainbridge.co.uk)
From: 1 Cindy Pott (cp768@redmond.co.uk)
Date: May 15, 10:38 A.M.
Subject: Bradford Project
Please find attached with this email the details of the bid for the Bradford Project we discussed over the phone earlier today. After reviewing all factors involved, we will be able to commence the construction on July 15 as requested in previous documentation. Given our successful service regarding your premises in Yorkshire, we hope you to be doing business again. Furthermore, a prompt decision before May 21 will allow us to give you a 20% discount on construction license fees.
Thank you,
Cindy Pott
Redmond Construction Inc.

questions.question_text: What is suggested about Mr. O’Neil?
answers: (A) He will be expanding his business.
(C) His company was selected by the council.
(D) His office is in need of construction.
questions.correct_answer: (D) His office is in need of construction.

questions.question_text: In the letter, the word “singular” in paragraph 2, line 3, is closest in meaning to
When does Mr. O’Neil want the project to start?
What does Ms. Pott offer?
What qualification is mentioned by both companies?
answers: (C) Ability to complete earlier than scheduled

part_7.paragraph:
To: All Employees
From: Management
Date: September 15
Re: Job Fairs
This is your chance to contribute to the success of the company. The Sheraton Hotel & Conference Center will be hosting three job fairs to hire staff for the upcoming holiday season. We would be thankful if employees from the cleaning staff, front desk, and lounge would participate in helping answer questions that applicants may have about the company.
Those employees that participate in two or more job fairs will be provided with one of the following benefits: a $100 cash bonus, a $150 gift certificate for the hotel restaurant, or a paid vacation day.
Interested employees should contact Ms. Jones via e-mail. Please include your name, employee ID number, division, and the date(s) you would like to participate. Please mention the benefit(s) you would like to receive.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------Welcome to the Job fairs 
All three job fairs will be held in the hotel convention hall.
The job fair schedule is as follows:
October 15 - 8:00 A.M. to 5:00 P.M.
October 27 - 9:00 A.M. to 12:00 P.M.
November 3 -10:00 A.M. to 3:00 P.M.---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
To: Katrina Jones (kjones@sheratonhotel.com)
From: Vicky Wheeler (vwheeler@sheratonhotel.com)
Subject: Re: Job fair
Date: September 18
Dear Ms. Jones,
I would like to volunteer to represent the Front Desk Staff at the October 15 and November 3 job fairs. I will be on holiday when the second job fair is scheduled, and therefore, will be unable to attend that one.
I feel that I will be able to answer questions asked by potential applicants, because I was hired as a result of attending the Sheraton Job Fair two years ago.
I have always wanted to dine at the hotel restaurant; therefore, I would like to receive the voucher as my benefit.
Regards,
Vicky Wheeler

questions.question_text: What is the reason for the memo?
answers: (D) To inform employees about a seminar

questions.question_text: In the memo, the word “chance” in paragraph 1, line 1, is closest in meaning to
On what date is Ms. Wheeler unable to attend the job fair?
What does Ms. Wheeler mention as a qualification?
What incentive does Ms. Wheeler request?
answers: (C) A complimentary stay at the hotel

part_7.paragraph:
Join US!Digital City brings today’s latest electronics products to its customers including televisions, stereos, computers, and more. Our number one priority is to build lasting relationships with our customers by providing trusted technology and entertainment expertise. We are looking for creative and hard-working individuals for the following positions. To apply, please email resumes and cover letters to Bethany Mills at bmills@digitalcity.com.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------Digital City’s TeamRegional Merchandising Manager  is experienced and knowledgeable of all aspects of merchandising including buying, inventory planning and designing displays. This job includes overseeing these tasks at all 8 of our stores in the region.Advertising Associate oversees the advertising team, assists in developing marketing campaigns, and purchases ad space. Must have at least 5 years of experience in a supervisory position.Warehouse Supervisor  provides daily oversight in the receipt, storage, and distribution of merchandise to our stores. Must have at least 2 years of experience.Marketing Assistant is an entry-level position for a recent university graduate with a degree in marketing. Digital City provides a comprehensive training and mentorship program.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
From: Minsu Park (minsupark@netstar.com)
To: Bethany Mills (bmills@digitalcity.com)
Subject: job opening
Date: October 14
Attachment: minsu_park.doc
Dear Ms. Mills,
My name is Minsu Park, and I am responding to your advertisement in yesterday’s Herald Dispatch. I am interested in applying for the marketing assistance position.
I believe I am very qualified for this position. I have attached my cover letter and resume to this e-mail. I would be happy to provide references upon request. I look forward to hearing | from you soon.
Sincerely,
Minsu Park

questions.question_text: What type of business is Digital City?
In the advertisement, the word “build”, in paragraph 1, line 3, is closest in meaning to
What is NOT required of the Advertising Associate?
answers: (C) Overseeing the work of other employees
(D) Having several years of relevant experience

questions.question_text: What is suggested about Mr. Park?
answers: (A) He previously worked for Digital City.
(B) He had an experience of supervising a team.

questions.question_text: What did Mr. Park send with his e-mail?

part_7.paragraph:
You are invited to a special gathering to acknowledge the opening of
Ancient Civilizations Anthropological Artifacts and their stories
Special Guest: Melvin Monroe
When : Wednesday, May 14/6 P.M. — 9 P.M.
Where : Edinburgh Museum Exhibition Hall
Next Event
Lecture: Asia Influences in Modern Art
Date: Saturday, June 17
Speaker: Ryu Maruyama---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------  Edinburgh Museum Wins Prestigious Design AwardAugust 8. Edinburgh - The Edinburgh Museum has won first place in the Publication Design Contest, sponsored annually by the European Museum Association, for its current exhibition, “Ancient Civilizations: Anthropological Artifacts and their stories”. The cover of the program for the exhibit features a photo montage of rock carvings from 10,000 B.C. The photographs were taken by renowned photographer, Alicia Coughlin.
This year, the Publication Design Contest attracted 211 submissions by 53 museums across Europe. Entries included books, calendars, educational materials, invitations, brochures, newsletters, posters, and web-sites. Past winners have included Madrid Museum in Spain, for “Planets from Beyond” catalog exhibition and Dusseldorf Museum in Belgium, for its “Asian Temples” exhibit.
“Ancient Civilizations” was organized by museum director Morgan Atwater and designed by artist Melvin Monroe. The Edinburgh Museum is located just a few blocks from City Hall and is open on Tuesday through Saturday from 9 A.M. to 5 P.M. It is closed on Mondays, Sundays, and on all national holidays. The upcoming exhibit, “The Future is Now” features high tech methods used to extract and study fossils and bones. For more information, contact us now!!!
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------Edinburgh Museum Exhibition Hall 
Open from May 12 until November 1
Telephone: (07) 5432 4476
www.edinburghmuseum.uk/exhibition
Please refer to the enclosed exhibition pamphlet for schedules and additional information.

questions.question_text: What happened on June 17?
What is stated about Edinburgh Museum?
answers: (B) It has sponsored European Museum Association.
(C) Mr. Atwater is a director of a museum.
(D) Melvin Monroe has designed all the exhibitions.
questions.correct_answer: (C) Mr. Atwater is a director of a museum.

questions.question_text: What is indicated about the European Museum Association?
answers: (A) It is located in Madrid, Spain.
(C) Its office is closed on weekends.
(D) It holds a contest every year.
questions.correct_answer: (D) It holds a contest every year.

questions.question_text: For what did the Edinburgh Museum win an award?
What will be exhibited on November 2?
answers: (A) The future study of fossils and bones
questions.correct_answer: (A) The future study of fossils and bones
